name: Systems Software
description: Understand operating systems, utility software, and system management

questions.question_text: Match each operating system function to its correct task:

pairs.match: Transfers programs from storage to RAM
Lets the user organise files into folders
Enables the user to interact with the system

model_answer: Transfers programs from storage to RAM
Lets the user organise files into folders
Enables the user to interact with the system
questions.explanation: Each operating system function serves a distinct purpose, from handling memory and peripherals to providing a way for users to interact with the system and organise their files.

questions.question_text:
Fill in the blanks about utility software:

__________ software uses a __________ to change data. Even if intercepted, the data can't be __________. __________ software arranges scattered parts of files into __________ blocks, improving the __________ at which data can be read.
State why utility software is important in a computer system.
questions.model_answer: Utility software performs background tasks to keep the computer running efficiently, such as managing files, detecting issues, and improving performance.

questions.question_text: Explain why a computer runs more efficiently after using defragmentation software.
questions.model_answer: Defragmentation arranges scattered parts of files into continuous blocks, reducing the time the disk needs to read and write data, which improves overall speed.

questions.question_text: Match each system action to the operating system function that handles it:

pairs.statement: Moving data between RAM and virtual memory
Creating a folder to organise files

questions.explanation: The OS assigns specific roles to different components to manage tasks like memory access, file organisation, and user authentication.

questions.question_text: Describe how a computer's hard drive may become fragmented over time.
questions.model_answer: As files are added and removed, gaps form on the disk. New files may not fit into these gaps completely, so they get split across multiple locations, causing fragmentation.

questions.question_text: Explain how defragmentation software can improve computer performance.
questions.model_answer: It reorganises files to be stored in continuous blocks and groups free space together, making it quicker for the disk to read or write data.

questions.question_text: What is the main purpose of an operating system?
questions.model_answer: To manage computer hardware and software resources, and provide common services for programs.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a function of an operating system?
questions.model_answer: Running antivirus scans
questions.explanation: Antivirus is a type of utility software, not a core function of the operating system.

questions.question_text: An operating system allows more than one program to run at the same time.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: This is called multitasking, managed by the OS allocating memory and CPU time to each process.

questions.question_text: Describe how an operating system manages memory.
questions.model_answer: It allocates memory space to programs, keeps track of what memory is being used, and swaps data between RAM and storage if needed.

questions.question_text: Match each function to its description:

pairs.match: Assigns access rights and login credentials
Controls how memory is allocated to programs
Organises and stores data on drives

model_answer: Assigns access rights and login credentials
Controls how memory is allocated to programs
Organises and stores data on drives
questions.explanation: Each component of the OS handles a distinct task: managing files, memory, users, and hardware.

questions.question_text: What is peripheral management and why is it important?
questions.model_answer: It is the process of handling communication between the CPU and devices like printers or keyboards. It ensures that input/output devices work correctly and drivers are used.

questions.question_text: The operating system manages both ______ and ______. It allows multiple applications to run through ______.
Explain one role of the user interface in an operating system.
questions.model_answer: It provides a way for the user to interact with the computer, such as through a graphical interface or command line.

questions.question_text: Which is a typical feature of a graphical user interface (GUI)?
questions.model_answer: Drag and drop
questions.explanation: GUIs use icons, windows, and mouse input – features like drag-and-drop are common.

questions.question_text: Operating systems allow different users to have different access rights.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: This is part of user management – assigning different permissions and accounts.

questions.question_text: Explain how an operating system allows a computer to run multiple programs at once.
questions.model_answer: The operating system allocates CPU time to each process and switches between them quickly, giving the illusion of multitasking. It manages memory so each program has the space it needs.

questions.question_text: State two tasks carried out by memory management within an operating system.
questions.model_answer:
1) Allocating memory to applications.
2) Managing data transfer between RAM and storage.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of peripheral management?
options: To manage the keyboard and mouse
questions.model_answer: To manage the keyboard and mouse
questions.explanation: Peripheral management ensures that devices like the keyboard, mouse, and printer communicate properly with the system using drivers.

questions.question_text: Describe one reason why drivers are needed for peripheral devices.
questions.model_answer: Drivers translate the commands from the operating system into signals the device can understand.

questions.question_text: What does the file management system of an operating system do?
questions.model_answer: It handles the saving, moving, naming, and organisation of files in folders so they can be accessed and stored efficiently.

questions.question_text: An operating system is responsible for assigning usernames and controlling user access rights.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: True – this is part of the user management system within an operating system.

questions.question_text: Without an operating system, a user can still run programs manually.
questions.model_answer: false
questions.explanation: False – the operating system is essential for managing hardware and software so programs can run.

questions.question_text: An operating system provides a _______ for users to interact with the system. It also manages _______ devices using drivers, and handles memory and _______ for programs.
What is meant by file permissions?
questions.model_answer: File permissions define who can read, write, or execute a file. This helps protect sensitive data.

questions.question_text: Match each OS feature to its description:

pairs.match: Allocates space to applications and manages data transfer
Manages input and output devices using drivers
Controls login credentials and access rights

model_answer: Allocates space to applications and manages data transfer
Manages input and output devices using drivers
Controls login credentials and access rights
questions.explanation: Each of these operating system components plays a distinct role in maintaining system usability and security.

questions.question_text: What is the main purpose of data compression software?
options: To save space by reducing file size
questions.model_answer: To save space by reducing file size
questions.explanation: Data compression software reduces file size for faster transfer and less storage usage.

questions.question_text: Describe the purpose of defragmentation software.
questions.model_answer: It rearranges files on a hard disk to be stored in continuous blocks, improving read/write speed.

questions.question_text: What is the benefit of using encryption software?
questions.model_answer: It protects sensitive data by converting it into unreadable code without the correct decryption key.

questions.question_text: Utility software performs ______ tasks that help keep the system running smoothly. Examples include ______ files, ______ data, and compression.
Encryption software scrambles data so it cannot be read without a key.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: True – this makes encrypted data secure from unauthorised access.

questions.question_text: Defragmentation software deletes duplicate files to free up space.
questions.model_answer: false
questions.explanation: False – defragmentation reorganises file storage on the disk but does not delete files.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a typical use for utility software?
questions.model_answer: Scanning for malware
questions.explanation: Utility software helps maintain the system, and scanning for malware is one such task.

questions.question_text: Give two reasons why data might be compressed before sending over a network.
questions.model_answer:
1) To reduce transfer time.
2) To use less bandwidth.

questions.question_text: Explain one reason an operating system might restrict user access levels.
questions.model_answer: To prevent unauthorised changes to system settings or access to sensitive files.

questions.question_text: What is a driver and why is it necessary?
questions.model_answer: A driver is a small program that tells the operating system how to communicate with hardware devices. Without drivers, the OS wouldn't be able to send the correct signals to use the device properly.

questions.question_text: Explain two reasons why file management is an essential function of an operating system.
questions.model_answer:
1) It allows files to be named, stored in folders, and moved easily.
2) It helps organise data so users and software can locate and access files efficiently.

questions.question_text: The operating system is responsible for handling keyboard and mouse input.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: True – The OS manages input devices through drivers and passes the data to the appropriate applications.

questions.question_text: Which of the following tasks is the operating system NOT responsible for?
questions.model_answer: Translating source code
questions.explanation: Translating source code is done by compilers or interpreters, not the operating system.

questions.question_text: Describe how an operating system manages multitasking.
questions.model_answer: The OS uses memory and process scheduling to allow multiple programs to run by rapidly switching between them, allocating CPU time and memory to each.

questions.question_text: What is defragmentation and how does it improve performance?
questions.model_answer: Defragmentation rearranges the parts of files stored on a hard disk so they are stored together. This reduces the time needed for the disk to read files, improving speed.

questions.question_text: Give one benefit of using encryption software.
questions.model_answer: It makes data unreadable without a decryption key, protecting it from unauthorised access.

questions.question_text: What is the main role of the user interface in an operating system?
questions.model_answer: It allows users to interact with the computer, either through text-based commands or graphical icons and windows.

questions.question_text: Defragmentation software is not needed if a computer uses a solid state drive (SSD).
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: True – SSDs access memory electronically rather than mechanically, so fragmentation doesn't affect performance in the same way it does on hard drives.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a responsibility of memory management?
questions.model_answer: Allowing multitasking
questions.explanation: Memory management handles how programs are loaded and run, making multitasking possible.

questions.question_text: What is the function of compression software?
questions.model_answer: It reduces the size of files by encoding data more efficiently, saving storage space and making file transfer faster.

questions.question_text: The OS controls access rights to files and programs for different users.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: True – User management includes controlling permissions, allowing or restricting access to parts of the system.

questions.question_text: Explain one way an OS helps with security through user management.
questions.model_answer: It can assign specific permissions or access levels to different users, preventing unauthorised access to sensitive files.

questions.question_text: Which of these is an example of utility software?
questions.model_answer: File compression tool
questions.explanation: Utility software performs maintenance tasks such as compression, defragmentation, and encryption, unlike application software.

questions.question_text: Encryption software ensures data can't be accessed by unauthorised users.
questions.model_answer: true
questions.explanation: True – Encryption changes the data into unreadable form unless a user has the correct key to decrypt it.

questions.question_text: Why is data compression especially useful when sending files over the internet?
questions.model_answer: Because it reduces the file size, speeding up transfer and using less bandwidth.

questions.question_text: Name two features of a graphical user interface (GUI).
questions.model_answer:
1) Uses icons and windows to represent programs and files.
2) Allows interaction using a mouse or touchscreen.

questions.question_text: A command-line interface is easier to use than a GUI for most users.
questions.model_answer: false
questions.explanation: False – CLIs require users to remember and type commands, while GUIs are more intuitive and visual.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes what defragmentation does?
options: Arranges fragmented files to speed up disk access
Encrypts data to prevent unauthorised access
questions.model_answer: Arranges fragmented files to speed up disk access
questions.explanation: Defragmentation reorganises files so their parts are stored contiguously, reducing read time.

questions.question_text: State one benefit of memory management for running applications.
questions.model_answer: It allocates RAM to different programs so they can run without interfering with each other.

questions.question_text: State what utility software is used for.
questions.model_answer: To help manage, maintain, or protect the computer system.

questions.question_text: Give two examples of utility software.
questions.model_answer: Antivirus software, disk defragmentation, backup, compression, or encryption (any two).

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of disk defragmentation?
questions.model_answer: To reorganise files so parts are stored together, which can speed up access time.

questions.question_text: Explain how compression software can benefit a user.
questions.model_answer: It reduces file size, making files easier to store or transfer.

questions.question_text: Why is encryption software important for file security?
questions.model_answer: It scrambles data so that only authorised users with the key can read it.

questions.question_text: Give one reason why backup utilities are important.
questions.model_answer: They allow data to be restored if it is lost or corrupted.
